name: AppProvider
description: Sets up the Polaris AppProvider and injects the App Bridge script.

definitions.title: props
definitions.description: React component that sets up App Bridge and Polaris.

AppProviderProps.name: AppProviderProps

members.name: children
members.description: Inner content of the application

members.name: apiKey
members.description: The API key for your Shopify app.

members.name: isEmbeddedApp
members.description: Whether the app is embedded or not. Defaults to `true`.

members.name: i18n
members.description: The i18n configuration for your Polaris provider.

members.name: __APP_BRIDGE_URL
members.description: Used internally by Shopify. You should not need to set this.

members.name: features
members.description: For toggling features

members.name: children
members.description: Inner content of the application

name: authenticate
description: Contains functions to authenticate requests from different Shopify surfaces. It can be used to validate requests coming from Shopify Admin, webhooks or extensions.

definitions.title: authenticate
definitions.description: Authenticate requests from Shopify. Different Shopify surfaces use different authentication methods, use the methods in this object to easily verify that calls are coming from Shopify.

Authenticate.name: Authenticate

members.name: admin
members.description:
Authenticate an admin Request and get back an authenticated admin context.  Use the authenticated admin context to interact with Shopify

Examples of when to use this are requests from your app's UI, or requests from admin extensions.

If there is no session for the Request, this will redirect the merchant to correct auth flows.

members.name: public
members.description:
Authenticate a public request and get back a session token

An example of when to use this is a request from a checkout extension.

members.name: webhook
members.description: Authenticate a Shopify webhook request, get back an authenticated admin context and details on the webhook request

  ? NonEmbeddedAdminContext<Config, Resources>
  : EmbeddedAdminContext<Config, Resources>

NonEmbeddedAdminContext.name: NonEmbeddedAdminContext

members.name: session
members.description:
The session for the user who made the request.

This comes from the session storage which `shopifyApp` uses to store sessions in your database of choice.

Use this to get shop or user specific data.

members.name: admin
members.description: Methods for interacting with the Shopify GraphQL / REST Admin APIs for the store that made the request

members.name: billing
members.description: Billing methods for this store, based on the plans defined in the `billing` config option.

members.name: cors
members.description: A function that ensures the CORS headers are set correctly for the response

export interface NonEmbeddedAdminContext<
  Config extends AppConfigArg,
  Resources extends ShopifyRestResources = ShopifyRestResources,
> extends AdminContextInternal<Config, Resources> {}

AdminApiContext.name: AdminApiContext

members.name: rest
members.description:
Methods for interacting with the Shopify Admin REST API

There are methods for interacting with individual REST resources. You can also make plain `GET`, `POST`, `PUT` and `DELETE` requests should the REST resources not meet your needs.

members.description: Methods for interacting with the Shopify Admin GraphQL API

members.name: require
members.description: Checks if the shop has an active payment for any the given plans defined in the `billing` config option.

members.name: request
members.description: Requests payment for the given plan.

members.name: cancel
members.description: Cancels an ongoing subscription, given its id.

RequireBillingOptions.name: RequireBillingOptions

members.name: plans
members.description: The plans to check for. Must be one of the values defined in the `billing` config option.

members.name: onFailure
members.description: How to handle the request if the shop does not have an active payment for any of the given plans.

RequestBillingOptions.name: RequestBillingOptions

members.name: plan
members.description: The plan to request. Must be one of the values defined in the `billing` config option.

members.description: The ID of the subscription to cancel.

members.name: prorate
members.description: Whether to prorate the cancellation.

JSONValue.name: JSONValue
JSONValue.value: string | number | boolean | null | JSONObject | JSONArray

members.name: length
members.description: Gets or sets the length of the array. This is a number one higher than the highest index in the array.

members.name: toString
members.description: Returns a string representation of an array.

members.name: toLocaleString
members.description: Returns a string representation of an array. The elements are converted to string using their toLocaleString methods.

members.name: pop
members.description:
Removes the last element from an array and returns it.
If the array is empty, undefined is returned and the array is not modified.

members.name: push
members.description: Appends new elements to the end of an array, and returns the new length of the array.

members.name: concat
members.description:
Combines two or more arrays.
This method returns a new array without modifying any existing arrays.

members.name: join
members.description: Adds all the elements of an array into a string, separated by the specified separator string.

members.name: reverse
members.description:
Reverses the elements in an array in place.
This method mutates the array and returns a reference to the same array.

members.name: shift
members.description:
Removes the first element from an array and returns it.
If the array is empty, undefined is returned and the array is not modified.

members.name: slice
members.description:
Returns a copy of a section of an array.
For both start and end, a negative index can be used to indicate an offset from the end of the array.
For example, -2 refers to the second to last element of the array.

members.name: sort
members.description:
Sorts an array in place.
This method mutates the array and returns a reference to the same array.

members.name: splice
members.value: { (start: number, deleteCount?: number): JSONValue[]; (start: number, deleteCount: number, ...items: JSONValue[]): JSONValue[]; }
members.description: Removes elements from an array and, if necessary, inserts new elements in their place, returning the deleted elements.

members.name: unshift
members.description: Inserts new elements at the start of an array, and returns the new length of the array.

members.name: indexOf
members.description: Returns the index of the first occurrence of a value in an array, or -1 if it is not present.

members.name: lastIndexOf
members.description: Returns the index of the last occurrence of a specified value in an array, or -1 if it is not present.

members.name: every
members.value: { <S extends JSONValue>(predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => value is S, thisArg?: any): this is S[]; (predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => unknown, thisArg?: any): boolean; }
members.description: Determines whether all the members of an array satisfy the specified test.

members.name: some
members.value: (predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => unknown, thisArg?: any) => boolean
members.description: Determines whether the specified callback function returns true for any element of an array.

members.name: forEach
members.value: (callbackfn: (value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => void, thisArg?: any) => void
members.description: Performs the specified action for each element in an array.

members.name: map
members.value: <U>(callbackfn: (value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => U, thisArg?: any) => U[]
members.description: Calls a defined callback function on each element of an array, and returns an array that contains the results.

members.name: filter
members.value: { <S extends JSONValue>(predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => value is S, thisArg?: any): S[]; (predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => unknown, thisArg?: any): JSONValue[]; }
members.description: Returns the elements of an array that meet the condition specified in a callback function.

members.name: reduce
members.value: { (callbackfn: (previousValue: JSONValue, currentValue: JSONValue, currentIndex: number, array: JSONValue[]) => JSONValue): JSONValue; (callbackfn: (previousValue: JSONValue, currentValue: JSONValue, currentIndex: number, array: JSONValue[]) => JSONValue, initialValue: JSONValue): JSONValue; <U>(callbackfn: (previousValue: U, currentValue: JSONValue, currentIndex: number, array: JSONValue[]) => U, initialValue: U): U; }
members.description: Calls the specified callback function for all the elements in an array. The return value of the callback function is the accumulated result, and is provided as an argument in the next call to the callback function.

members.name: reduceRight
members.value: { (callbackfn: (previousValue: JSONValue, currentValue: JSONValue, currentIndex: number, array: JSONValue[]) => JSONValue): JSONValue; (callbackfn: (previousValue: JSONValue, currentValue: JSONValue, currentIndex: number, array: JSONValue[]) => JSONValue, initialValue: JSONValue): JSONValue; <U>(callbackfn: (previousValue: U, currentValue: JSONValue, currentIndex: number, array: JSONValue[]) => U, initialValue: U): U; }
members.description: Calls the specified callback function for all the elements in an array, in descending order. The return value of the callback function is the accumulated result, and is provided as an argument in the next call to the callback function.

members.name: find
members.value: { <S extends JSONValue>(predicate: (this: void, value: JSONValue, index: number, obj: JSONValue[]) => value is S, thisArg?: any): S; (predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, obj: JSONValue[]) => unknown, thisArg?: any): JSONValue; }
members.description:
Returns the value of the first element in the array where predicate is true, and undefined
otherwise.

members.name: findIndex
members.value: (predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, obj: JSONValue[]) => unknown, thisArg?: any) => number
members.description:
Returns the index of the first element in the array where predicate is true, and -1
otherwise.

members.name: fill
members.value: (value: JSONValue, start?: number, end?: number) => JSONArray
members.description: Changes all array elements from `start` to `end` index to a static `value` and returns the modified array

members.name: copyWithin
members.value: (target: number, start: number, end?: number) => JSONArray
members.description:
Returns the this object after copying a section of the array identified by start and end
to the same array starting at position target

members.name: entries
members.description: Returns an iterable of key, value pairs for every entry in the array

members.name: keys
members.description: Returns an iterable of keys in the array

members.name: values
members.description: Returns an iterable of values in the array

members.name: includes
members.description: Determines whether an array includes a certain element, returning true or false as appropriate.

members.name: flatMap
members.value: <U, This = undefined>(callback: (this: This, value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => U | readonly U[], thisArg?: This) => U[]
members.description:
Calls a defined callback function on each element of an array. Then, flattens the result into
a new array.
This is identical to a map followed by flat with depth 1.

members.name: flat
members.value: <A, D extends number = 1>(this: A, depth?: D) => FlatArray<A, D>[]
members.description:
Returns a new array with all sub-array elements concatenated into it recursively up to the
specified depth.

members.name: __@iterator@341
members.description: Iterator

members.name: __@unscopables@343
members.value: () => { copyWithin: boolean; entries: boolean; fill: boolean; find: boolean; findIndex: boolean; keys: boolean; values: boolean; }
members.description:
Returns an object whose properties have the value 'true'
when they will be absent when used in a 'with' statement.

members.name: at
members.description:
Takes an integer value and returns the item at that index,
allowing for positive and negative integers.
Negative integers count back from the last item in the array.

WebhookContextWithSession.name: WebhookContextWithSession

examples.description: How to authenticate requests from the Shopify platform.
Authenticate requests coming from Shopify Admin.

tabs.title: Admin

examples.description: Authenticate public request coming from Shopify checkout extensions.

tabs.title: Public
Webhook

name: addDocumentResponseHeaders
description:
Ensures all responses have the right headers for apps to be embedded into Shopify Admin.

This should be called on any request that returns a document.

definitions.title: addDocumentResponseHeaders
definitions.description: Adds headers to the response, so that the app can be loaded in an iframe.

defaultExample.description: Add headers to all document responses.

tabs.title: addDocumentResponseHeaders

name: login
description:
Logs a store into the app via Shopify, requesting merchant permissions if it is not installed yet.

If successful, the merchant will be automatically redirected.

This function is only available for apps using the `AppDistribution.AppStore` value for `distribution`.

definitions.title: login
definitions.description: Obtains a shop from either the search params or POST form data, and triggers a login process.

tabs.title: Login

name: registerWebhooks
description: Enables apps to register webhooks to listen to events from Shopify.

definitions.title: registerWebhooks
definitions.description: Sets up the configured listeners for the current session.

RegisterWebhooksOptions.name: RegisterWebhooksOptions

members.name: session
members.description: The Shopify session used to register webhooks via the Admin API.

tabs.title: registerWebhooks

name: sessionStorage
description: Enables apps to manage sessions used by the Remix package to authenticate users and requests.

tabs.title: SessionStorage

name: shopifyApp
description: Creates an object your app will use to interact with Shopify.

definitions.title: shopifyApp
definitions.description: Function to create a new Shopify API object.

ShopifyAppGeneratedType.name: ShopifyAppGeneratedType
ShopifyAppGeneratedType.description: Creates an object your app will use to interact with Shopify.

params.name: appConfig
params.description: Configuration options for your shopify app.  For example, the scopes your app needs.

returns.description: `ShopifyApp` An object constructed using your appConfig.  It has methods for interacting with Shopify.
returns.name: ShopifyApp<Config extends AppConfigArg<Resources, Storage>>

AppConfigArg.name: AppConfigArg

members.name: appUrl
members.description:
The URL your app is running on.

The `@shopify/cli` provides this URL as `process.env.SHOPIFY_APP_URL`.  For development this is probably a tunnel URL that points to your local machine.  If production this is your production URL.

members.name: sessionStorage
members.description:
An adaptor for storing sessions in your database of choice.

Shopify provides multiple session storage adaptors and you can create your own.

members.name: useOnlineTokens
members.description:
Does your app use online or just offline tokens.

If your app uses online tokens both online and offline tokens will be saved to your database.  This ensures your app can perform background jobs

members.name: webhooks
members.description:
The config for the webhook topics your app would like to subscribe to.







This can be in used in conjunction with the afterAuth hook to register webhook topics when a user installs your app.  Or you can use this function in other processes such as background jobs.

members.name: hooks
members.description:
Functions to call at key places during your apps lifecycle.

These functions are called in the context of the request that triggered them.  This means you can access the session.

members.name: isEmbeddedApp
members.description:
Does your app render embedded inside the Shopify Admin or on its own.

Unless you have very specific needs, this should be true.

members.name: distribution
members.description: How your app is distributed. Defaults to app store.

members.name: apiVersion
members.description: What version of Shopify's Admin API's would you like to use.

members.name: authPathPrefix
members.description:
A path that Shopify can reserve for auth related endpoints.

This must match a $ route in your Remix app.  That route must export a loader function that calls `shopify.authenticate.admin(request)`.

members.name: logger
members.value: { log?: LogFunction; level?: LogSeverity; httpRequests?: boolean; timestamps?: boolean; }

WebhookConfig.name: WebhookConfig

HooksConfig.name: HooksConfig

members.name: afterAuth
members.description: A function to call after a merchant installs your app

ShopifyApp.name: ShopifyApp
ShopifyApp.value:
Config['distribution'] extends AppDistribution.ShopifyAdmin
    ? AdminApp<Config>
    : Config['distribution'] extends AppDistribution.SingleMerchant
    ? SingleMerchantApp<Config>
    : Config['distribution'] extends AppDistribution.AppStore
    ? AppStoreApp<Config>
    : AppStoreApp<Config>
ShopifyApp.description:
An object your app can use to interact with Shopify.

By default, the app's distribution will be AppStore.

members.name: sessionStorage
members.description:
The SessionStorage instance your app is using.

An instance of the SessionStorage class you passed in as a config option.

members.name: addDocumentResponseHeaders
members.description: Adds the required Content Security Policy headers for Shopify apps to the given Headers object.

members.name: registerWebhooks
members.description: Register webhook topics for a store using the given session. Most likely you want to use this in combination with the afterAuth hook.

members.name: authenticate
members.description: Ways to authenticate requests from different surfaces across Shopify.

members.name: unauthenticated
members.description: Ways to get Contexts from requests that do not originate from Shopify.

members.name: session
members.description: The Shopify session used to register webhooks via the Admin API.

members.name: admin
members.description:
Authenticate an admin Request and get back an authenticated admin context.  Use the authenticated admin context to interact with Shopify

Examples of when to use this are requests from your app's UI, or requests from admin extensions.

If there is no session for the Request, this will redirect the merchant to correct auth flows.

members.name: public
members.description:
Authenticate a public request and get back a session token

An example of when to use this is a request from a checkout extension.

members.name: webhook
members.description: Authenticate a Shopify webhook request, get back an authenticated admin context and details on the webhook request

members.name: fill
members.value: (value: JSONValue, start?: number, end?: number) => JSONArray
members.description: Changes all array elements from `start` to `end` index to a static `value` and returns the modified array

members.name: copyWithin
members.value: (target: number, start: number, end?: number) => JSONArray
members.description:
Returns the this object after copying a section of the array identified by start and end
to the same array starting at position target

members.name: entries
members.description: Returns an iterable of key, value pairs for every entry in the array

members.name: keys
members.description: Returns an iterable of keys in the array

members.name: values
members.description: Returns an iterable of values in the array

members.name: includes
members.description: Determines whether an array includes a certain element, returning true or false as appropriate.

members.name: flatMap
members.value: <U, This = undefined>(callback: (this: This, value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => U | readonly U[], thisArg?: This) => U[]
members.description:
Calls a defined callback function on each element of an array. Then, flattens the result into
a new array.
This is identical to a map followed by flat with depth 1.

members.name: flat
members.value: <A, D extends number = 1>(this: A, depth?: D) => FlatArray<A, D>[]
members.description:
Returns a new array with all sub-array elements concatenated into it recursively up to the
specified depth.

members.name: __@iterator@341
members.description: Iterator

members.name: __@unscopables@343
members.value: () => { copyWithin: boolean; entries: boolean; fill: boolean; find: boolean; findIndex: boolean; keys: boolean; values: boolean; }
members.description:
Returns an object whose properties have the value 'true'
when they will be absent when used in a 'with' statement.

members.name: at
members.description:
Takes an integer value and returns the item at that index,
allowing for positive and negative integers.
Negative integers count back from the last item in the array.

WebhookContextWithSession.name: WebhookContextWithSession

Unauthenticated.name: Unauthenticated

members.name: admin
members.description:
Get an admin context by passing a shop

**Warning** This should only be used for Requests that do not originate from Shopify.
You must do your own authentication before using this method.
This method throws an error if there is no session for the shop.

UnauthenticatedAdminContext.name: UnauthenticatedAdminContext

members.name: session
members.description:
The session for the given shop.

This comes from the session storage which `shopifyApp` uses to store sessions in your database of choice.

This will always be an offline session. You can use to get shop specific data.

members.name: admin
members.description: Methods for interacting with the Shopify GraphQL / REST Admin APIs for the given store.

ShopifyAppBase.name: ShopifyAppBase

members.name: sessionStorage
members.description:
The SessionStorage instance your app is using.

An instance of the SessionStorage class you passed in as a config option.

members.name: addDocumentResponseHeaders
members.description: Adds the required Content Security Policy headers for Shopify apps to the given Headers object.

members.name: registerWebhooks
members.description: Register webhook topics for a store using the given session. Most likely you want to use this in combination with the afterAuth hook.

members.name: authenticate
members.description: Ways to authenticate requests from different surfaces across Shopify.

members.name: unauthenticated
members.description: Ways to get Contexts from requests that do not originate from Shopify.

ShopifyAppLogin.name: ShopifyAppLogin

members.name: login
members.description:
Log a merchant in, and redirect them to the app root. Will redirect the merchant to authentication if a shop is
present in the URL search parameters or form data.

This function won't be present when the `distribution` config option is set to `AppDistribution.ShopifyAdmin`,
because Admin apps aren't allowed to show a login page.

name: unauthenticated
description:
Contains functions to obtain unauthenticated contexts from requests not sent by Shopify.

> Caution: These functions do not perform **any** validation and should **never** rely on user input.

Unauthenticated.name: Unauthenticated

members.name: admin
members.description:
Get an admin context by passing a shop

**Warning** This should only be used for Requests that do not originate from Shopify.
You must do your own authentication before using this method.
This method throws an error if there is no session for the shop.

AdminApiContext.name: AdminApiContext

members.name: rest
members.description:
Methods for interacting with the Shopify Admin REST API

There are methods for interacting with individual REST resources. You can also make plain `GET`, `POST`, `PUT` and `DELETE` requests should the REST resources not meet your needs.
